title: Stocks - Apple, Facebook, Ford Fall in Premarket Trade
text:
© Reuters.

Investing.com - Stocks in focus in premarket trading on Tuesday:

• Apple (NASDAQ: ) stock inched down 0.1% in premarket trade by 8:20 AM ET (12:20 GMT) ahead of an expected announcement on pricing for its TV streaming service, which is scheduled to accompany the latest updates to its iPhone lineup.

• Facebook (NASDAQ: ) stock was down 0.5% while Google (NASDAQ: ) was down 0.4% after U.S. states expanded their antitrust activity against big Internet platforms.

• Altria (NYSE: ) stock fell 0.6% after Piper Jaffray lowered its rating of the tobacco company to 'neutral' from 'overweight' due to concerns over its potential merger with Philip Morris International (NYSE: ) and increased regulatory scrutiny of vaping products, CNBC reported.

• Ford Motor Company (NYSE: ) stock dipped 4.5% after ratings agency Moody's downgraded its bond rating to junk status on Monday.

• Ctrip.Com (NASDAQ: ) stock fell 3.2% after the China-based travel service’s revenue came in below forecasts.

• Wendy’s (NASDAQ: ) stock slumped 6.7% after it announced it was spending $20 million to bring breakfast to more than 5,800 domestic locations. The company will have to hire 20,000 extra staff for the initiative.
description: Stocks - Apple, Facebook, Ford Fall in Premarket Trade
